lines.text: [first lines]
[reading the plaque on a statue]
"Timothy Owens, Founder of Owensville"
What does it mean "founded it"? Was it losted?
When we rode you out of town, Skelly, it was on a one-way ticket and that still holds.
Mr. Owens, it just happened that I have business to attend to here.
I doubt that. We don't do business with gamblers and gunmen. We leave that to Canyon City.
Well, at least Canyon City has life it in. They bury their dead instead of letting them roam the streets.
[the Three Mesquiteers enter a rough-looking saloon]
Three sarsaparillas.
[One of the Cherokee Boys breaks the Mesquiteers' three bottles of pop]
Had enough Sarsaparilla?
Just enough!
[a barroom brawl ensues and the Three Mesquiteers knock out the bad guys]
That Sarsaparilla is powerful stuff!
[Owens mistakes the Three Mesquiteers for the villainous Cherokee Boys]
Let's get this straight. You want somebody killed and you're willing to pay a $1000 for the job?
That's it, and I hired you killers to ensure against any bungling. The man must be killed expertly and painlessly and not later than tomorrow.
Who's the man?
Yeah, we gotta warn him.
Warn him?
Uh, sure! We always give 'em a sportin' chance. We like to do things the hard way.
This time I don't want the man warned.
Who is he?
The man I want killed is... me.
[the Cherokee Boys try to ambush the Three Mesquiteers]
It's those guys hauntin' us again!
We'll show 'em what happens when the Cherokees meet their ghosts!
[when Tom Owens mistakes the Mesquiteers for the Cherokee Gang, the Sheriff arrests them]
Why he's crazy. The guys we plugged back on the road are the real Cherokees!
I'll settle for the Cherokees we got. Head 'em for jail!
Your tombstones are gonna read, "Here lie the Cherokee Boys" and mine will read, "I Told You So!"
Me and Thumber and Butch are the original and only Cherokees. These hombres are impersonatin' us and you know, Sheriff, that ain't legal!
You're right, it ain't!
[Janet slaps Skelly]
And that's for impersonating a gentleman.
[last lines]
Thank you, boys, for this Owens family reunion. You know, I don't think I made such a bad mistake in hiring you after all!
